Package de.lessvoid.nifty.tools

Class SizeValue

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.SizeValue
@Immutable public final class SizeValue extends Object
The SizeValue class stores and manages size value strings. Such strings are used to store size representations. See the constants for all supported special kind of values.

    • MAX_PERCENT

      public static final float MAX_PERCENT
      Max percent constant.

  • Constructor Details

    • SizeValue

      public SizeValue(@Nonnull SizeValueType type)
      Create a new instance of the size value that only contains a type. This only works for types that allow to be used without value.
      Parameters:
      type - the type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case the type requires a value
      See Also:
      • SizeValueType.getValueRequirement()

    • SizeValue

      public SizeValue(int value, @Nonnull SizeValueType type)
      Create a new instance of the size value that contains a value and a type. This only works for types that allow a fixed set value.
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      type - the type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case the type forbids the usage of a value or only accepts a calculated value
      See Also:
      • SizeValueType.getValueRequirement()

    • SizeValue

      public SizeValue(@Nonnull SizeValueType type, int calculatedValue)
      Create a new instance of a size value that contains a computed value and a type. This only works for values that do not require a fixed value and allow a computed value.
      Parameters:
      type - the type
      calculatedValue - the computed value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case the type forbids the usage of values or requires a fixed set value *
      See Also:
      • SizeValueType.getValueRequirement()

    • SizeValue

      public SizeValue(@Nullable String valueParam)
      This constructor is used to parse a size value from a string.

      This is the most expensive way to create a size value. Only use this if you really need to parse a string to get the size value. This method does not allow to set computed values as those are only set by the layout process that does not use this method to create its instances.

      Parameters:
      valueParam - the size value as string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case its not possible to parse the value

    • percentHeight

      @Nonnull public static SizeValue percentHeight(int percentage)
      Create a percentage based size value. This percentage will use the height of the parent element as reference. This value is only allowed to be used as width value.
      Parameters:
      percentage - percentage value
      Returns:
      the size value instance representing the percentage value
      See Also:
      • SizeValueType.PercentHeight

    • percentWidth

      @Nonnull public static SizeValue percentWidth(int percentage)
      Create a percentage based size value. This percentage will use the width of the parent element as reference. This value is only allowed to be used as height value.
      Parameters:
      percentage - percentage value
      Returns:
      the size value instance representing the percentage value
      See Also:
      • SizeValueType.PercentWidth

    • isIndependentFromParent

      public boolean isIndependentFromParent()
      Do we need to know the size of the parent element to calculate this value?
      Returns:
      true if the size of this value can be calculated without knowing about the parent.

    • isPercentOrPixel

      @Deprecated public boolean isPercentOrPixel()
      Deprecated.
      function got renamed to hasValue()
      Check if the size value contains a value either in percent or pixel.
      Returns:
      true in case its a pixel or percent value

    • hasValue

      public boolean hasValue()
      Checks if the value contains either PERCENT or PIXEL.
      Returns:
      true when either PERCENT or PIXEL is given.

    • getValue

      public float getValue(float range)
      Get the value as a float. WARNING: DO NOT CAST THE RETURN VALUE TO AN INTEGER - use getValueAsInt(float) or you will have off-by-one errors!
      Parameters:
      range - the size that percent values are calculated from.
      Returns:
      the resulting value as a float.

    • getValueAsInt

      public int getValueAsInt(float range)
      Get the value as int.
      Parameters:
      range - the size that percent values are calculated from.
      Returns:
      the resulting value rounded to the nearest integer.

    • getValueAsString

      public String getValueAsString()
      Get a string representation of this SizeValue that complies with the formatting standards for SizeValue(String) constructor.
      Returns:
      a well-formed string representation of this SizeValue

    • isPixel

      public boolean isPixel()
      Checks if this value describes a pixel value.
      Returns:
      true if the given string value ends with PIXEL and false otherwise

    • isPercent

      public boolean isPercent()
      Checks if this value describes a percent value.
      Returns:
      true if the given string value ends with PERCENT and false otherwise.

    • toString

      @Nonnull public String toString()
      Get a generic string representation of this size value.

      The output of this function is most likely not valid to be parsed by the SizeValue(String) constructor as it contains the current calculated value and this constructor does not support this kind of value. To get a String value parseable by the SizeValue(String) constructor, use getValueAsString().

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of this instance
